meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization is now extinct.
meanings.sent2: The dinosaurs are extinct and cannot be seen today.
meanings.sent3: The idea of using floppy disks is as extinct as dinosaurs.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was extinct after waiting for hours.
meanings.sent5: The once bustling town is now a ghostly, extinct place.

meanings.sent1: The old building was now extinct, reduced to rubble.
meanings.sent2: The forest fire left the trees extinct in its path.
meanings.sent3: His hopes of winning the game were extinct after the final whistle.
meanings.sent4: The once vibrant colors of the painting were now extinct, faded by time.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was extinct, shattered into countless pieces.

meanings.sent1: The dodo bird is an extinct species.
meanings.sent2: The woolly mammoth is an extinct animal from the past.
meanings.sent3: His interest in that hobby was extinct, like a flame that had burned out.
meanings.sent4: The music of the composer echoed through the halls, but he himself was extinct.
meanings.sent5: The once lively garden was now silent and extinct, devoid of any living creatures.
